intro: Guenthera repanda subsp. blancoana, commonly known as the Blancoana Guenthera, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its flowers are small and clustered. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations.
